newsitem.title: CANADA: Golden Knight announces Ghana mine plan.
newsitem.headline: Golden Knight announces Ghana mine plan.

text.p: A feasibility study has confirmed the viability of open pit gold mining at the Tarkwa concession in Ghana, part owner Golden Knight Resources Inc said Friday.

The mine is expected initially to produce 230,000 ounces of gold a year for the first five years at a cost of US$210 an ounce and a capital cost of US$125 million, Golden Knight said in a statement quoting Gold Fields of South Africa.
Gold Fields of South Africa Ltd holds 70 percent of Gold Fields Ghana Ltd which holds rights to the concession.
Golden Knight currently holds a five percent interest in Gold Fields Ghana but has made arrangements to spend US$47 million to increase its holdings to 17.5 percent.
Timing of the mine depends on negotiations with the remaining owners of the property and government officials, the statement said.
As of last December, measured gold resources at Tarkwa totalled 324.2 million tonnes of ore grading 0.040 ounces of gold per tonne, or 13 million ounces of gold.
The feasibility study was based on an annual mining rate of four million tonnes, later increasing to eight million tonnes in three of five areas explored.
